definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: This performance was a success and he was greeted by enthusiastic applause.
sentences.chinese: 這場音樂會相當成功，馬友友被報以熱烈的掌聲。

sentences.english: I could see a little YoYo Ma in him.
sentences.chinese: 我在他的身上看到一個小馬友友。

sentences.english: Barack Obama said Yo-Yo Ma is that you've had the most happy person.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬稱馬友友是自己遇到過的最快樂的人。

sentences.english: I remember hearing Yo-Yo Ma play the Bach sonatas for cello and keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 我記得我聽過馬友友拉的巴赫大提琴與鍵盤奏鳴曲。

sentences.english: Ma has gone on to experiment widely with other types of music.
sentences.chinese: 馬友友也廣泛涉獵其他類型的音樂。

sentences.english: The concert was a solo played by Yo Yo Ma, who is an excellent cellist.
sentences.chinese: 這場音樂會是馬友友獨奏，他是一位優秀的大提琴家。

sentences.english: Ma and his wife have two children.
sentences.chinese: 馬友友和他的妻子有兩個孩子。

sentences.english: Yo-Yo Ma gave his first public performance when he was only 5.
sentences.chinese: 馬友友了他第一次公開表演時，他只有5個。

sentences.english: Tom:For me, Yo-Yo Ma is as amazing as Mozart.
sentences.chinese: 馬友友對我而言就好像莫札特一樣厲害。

sentences.english: In 2006, Yo-Yo Ma was appointed as the United Nations peace ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 2006年，馬友友被聯合國任命爲和平大使。

sentences.english: Yo-Yo Ma was born in 1955 to Chinese parents living in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 馬友友出生於1955年，父母是旅居巴黎的中國人。
